Config.Name: 007 Everything or Nothing id#4760
Config.Notes: Round sprite fixes vertical lines in FMVs; very CPU-intensive game, can have some slowdown in intense moments, EE Cycle Rate -2 helps, but don't set to -3 because it will drop frames; same for any EE Cycle Skipping above 0; MTVU has a very weird impact on the game, it seems as though the game runs at half speed with it on, but can then run at 250%+ with the framelimiter off...

Config.Name: 18 Wheeler American Pro Trucker id#7238
Config.Notes: D3D is too dark, displays normally in GL

Config.Name: Ace Combat 04 Shattered Skies id#9620
Config.Notes: Has quite a few problems in hardware rendering, including missing clouds and the player's plane is black; some slowdown in software mode in external camera view

Config.Name: Ace Combat 5 The Unsung War id#3912
Config.Notes: Some occasional slight slowdown in cutscenes - moreso with D3D than GL, so using GL; HPO fixes some blurring around objects; align sprite fixes vertical lines; round sprite fixes horizontal lines in pause screen; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Ace Combat Zero The Belkan War id#4422
Config.Notes: HPO fixes some blurring around objects; align sprite fixes vertical lines; round sprite fixes horizontal lines in pause screen; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: AirBlade id#5869
Config.Notes: Skipdraw removes really ugly blur/depth of field effect in cutscenes, 1 | 1 removes the blur but then some light sources are visible through walls, so using 1 | 2 to remove the glow

Config.Name: Airforce Delta Strike id#5870
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines, mostly fixed by TC Offset

Config.Name: Alone in the Dark id#9065
Config.Notes: Has major z-fighting (texture flicker) issues, can be corrected by switching to software mode (pressing F9) but software has pretty frequent slowdown

Config.Name: Alone in the Dark The New Nightmare id#17686
Config.Notes: Widescreen patch doesn't adjust aspect ratio properly - config set to use 4:3 AR; choose 50hz when starting otherwise it'll use a weird aspect ratio

Config.Name: Alter Echo id#5878
Config.Notes: Some screen effects don't fill screen because of widescreen

Config.Name: Amplitude id#5881
Config.Notes: Spiky polygons on avatars; no Vsync improves timing; --fullboot required to start correctly; be aware that disabling framelimiter during loading will make it not finish loading correctly because of Async - can use Timestretch but Async feels a lot better; don't disable framelimiter before title screen otherwise the game will hang

Config.Name: Ape Escape 2 id#9625
Config.Notes: Some occasional flickering of distant geometry (imperfect mipmapping), not present in software rendering

Config.Name: Ape Escape 3 id#9626
Config.Notes: Some occasional slowdown (like in the theater in Banana Heel); some ghosting in some cutscenes; MTVU causes visual bugs (spiky polygons); game is much more CPU intensive than GPU; MTVU causes graphics corruption

Config.Name: Arc The Lad Twilight Of The Spirits id#9628
Config.Notes: DOF effect has major issues and is disabled via skipdraw 1 | 1; some occasional ghosting issues which are fixed by Disable Depth Emulation which removes them; Round Sprite=Full + TC Offset fixes the majority of upscaling lines

Config.Name: Armored Core 2 Another Age id#5886
Config.Notes: A few lines in text (minor)

Config.Name: Armored Core 2 id#5365
Config.Notes: A few lines in text (minor); the no interlacing patch causes FMVs to jitter, doesn't happen with Bob tff and gameplay looks the same - not using the patch

Config.Name: Armored Core 3 id#5408
Config.Notes: A few lines in text (minor); might need EE Round Mode set to positive, but haven't in testing

Config.Name: Armored Core Last Raven id#12247
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing and blur removal patch - unless this is used, Preload Frame Data needs to be enabled if using hardware rendering to prevent black screens during gameplay; Trilinear filtering helps with aliasing in terrain; lighting is wrong in D3D (from less accurate blending mode)

Config.Name: Armored Core Nine Breaker id#95318
Config.Notes: In missions game is interlaced which is fixed with Bob tff (makes the game sharper), but this causes all menus to jitter; FXAA has a pretty significant impact on performance and doesn't really do much with the interlacing

Config.Name: Armored Core Silent Line id#12886
Config.Notes: A few lines in text (minor), which can be eliminated by setting round sprite to half/full but then the UI jitters from Bob tff, game is missing geometry on some objects unless EE Round Mode is set to Positive

Config.Name: Baldur's Gate Dark Alliance id#5898
Config.Notes: Extremely system-intensive game, benefits from both Fast Texture Invalidation and Allow 8-bit Textures; EE cycle rate=3 may also help; MTVU seems to actually have a slightly negative impact on performance; reduce to 2x scaling if struggling with performance; D3D performs worse; graphics corruption on FMVs unless large framebuffer is enabled, which has a negative impact on performance (stuttering around fires) so software FMVs enabled with large framebuffer disabled; FXAA degrades software FMV quality a little bit but the rest of the game looks better; TC Offset improves some upscaling lines; tried the no interlacing patch - doesn't seem to make much of a difference other than making the text look awful so it's not used

Config.Name: Baldur's Gate Dark Alliance II id#5899
Config.Notes: Extremely system-intensive game, benefits from both Fast Texture Invalidation and Allow 8-bit Textures; EE cycle rate=3 may also help; MTVU seems to actually have a slightly negative impact on performance; reduce to 2x scaling if struggling with performance; D3D performs worse; graphics corruption on FMVs unless large framebuffer is enabled, which has a negative impact on performance (stuttering around fires) so software FMVs enabled with large framebuffer disabled; FXAA degrades software FMV quality a little bit but the rest of the game looks better; TC Offset improves some upscaling lines

Config.Name: Barbarian id#9631
Config.Notes: FXAA impacts performance at higher scaling

Config.Name: Baroque id#12947
Config.Notes: Lighting isn't quite right with D3D (bloom/bright)

Config.Name: Battle Assault 3 id#5902
Config.Notes: Hardware rendering is slow unless fast texture invalidation is used, which causes dark area on right side of screen; some visual effects don't work correctly in hardware rendering

Config.Name: Beat Down Fists of Vengeance id#27852
Config.Notes: Frequent z-fighting (flickering) on distant objects

Config.Name: Blood Omen 2 The Legacy Of Kain id#10243
Blood Will Tell id#12794
Config.Notes: Upscaling doesn't work correctly during prologue (first two levels) but does afterwards; D3D doesn't perform as well as GL; medium blending needed for text to be correct color (white, not gray) slowdown at 5x+ upscaling

Config.Name: Bloody Roar 3 id#11912
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Bombastic id#9955
Config.Notes: The game seems to have a slow boot/start time for some reason, it acts as though it's hanging, no issues during play though ; FXAA has a pretty big impact on maximum performance at 6x (about 100%)

Config.Name: Breath of Fire Dragon Quarter id#9636
Config.Notes: Character stroke lines aren't quite right with D3D unless Disable Safe Features is set; a few minor upscaling lines, improved by TC Offset; occasionally slows to less than 100% speed at 6x; using no interlacing patch; little bit of interlacing jitter on the map

Config.Name: Bujingai The Forsaken City id#5907
Config.Notes: TC Offset improves a few upscaling lines; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Burnout 3 Takedown id#4158
Config.Notes: Sun is visible through objects (Auto Flush doesn't fix it) and blur looks a little odd in hardware rendering, but otherwise very playable at 3x; higher blending accuracy causes huge slowdown; HPO fixes line in distance

Config.Name: Castlevania Lament Of Innocence id#11966
Config.Notes: Some occasional z-fighting in outdoor areas - some of which can be eliminated by setting texture filtering to nearest, but not all; artifacts (lines) in shadows in D3D unless "Disable Safe Features" is set; EE clamp mode fixes freeze before doppleganger fight; FXAA does have an impact on performance, but still runs at 200% at 5x, disable (PgUp) if needed for speed

Config.Name: Champions Of Norrath id#5923
Config.Notes: Benefits from both Fast Texture Invalidation and Allow 8-bit Textures; TC Offset improves some upscaling lines; 4x+ upscaling introduces some additional lines in UI; tried the no interlacing patch - doesn't seem to make much of a difference other than making the text look awful so it's not used

Config.Name: Champions Return To Arms id#5924
Config.Notes: Benefits from both Fast Texture Invalidation and Allow 8-bit Textures; TC Offset improves some upscaling lines; 4x+ upscaling introduces some additional lines in UI; tried the no interlacing patch - doesn't seem to make much of a difference other than making the text look awful so it's not used

Config.Name: Chaos Legion id#12915
Config.Notes: Summoned legions have squares underneath; VU Clamp mode fixes item menu; align sprite fixes vertical lines; Round Sprite fixes vertical line in the center of the screen during cutscenes, although there's still a slight transparent "seam"; FXAA does have an impact on performance, disable (PgUp) if necessary

Config.Name: Clock Tower 3 id#9644
Config.Notes: FXAA does have an impact on performance

Config.Name: Cold Fear id#10829
Config.Notes: Some occasionally glitching shadows

Config.Name: Contra Shattered Soldier id#5405
Config.Notes: TC Offset improves some upscaling lines

Config.Name: Crimson Sea 2 id#13064
Config.Notes: Small amout of jitter in cutscenes (from Bob tff); some characters have line in the middle from TC offset (which removes lines in text and UI); some horizontal lines in the graphical effect that appears when new enemies appear on the radar - only seems to be fixable with software rendering; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Crimson Tears id#12821
Config.Notes: Has bloom misalignment in some areas, half pixel offset and TC Offset correct some of this, but not all; game is interlaced, but Bob modes cause either the UI to jitter or the gameplay; occasional slowdown spikes at 6x

Config.Name: Curse The Eye Of Isis id#30683
Dark Angel Vampire Apocalypse id#15210
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines, mostly removed by TC Offset; Bob deinterlacing makes inventory and map jitter, switch to Auto if it bothers you

Config.Name: Dark Cloud 2 id#9649
Config.Notes: Round sprite fixes lines in text

Config.Name: Dark Cloud id#7201
Config.Notes: MTVU negatively impacts performance; FXAA has an impact on performance and isn't very noticeable due to interlacing so it's not used; using no interlacing patch (big improvement because Bob tff isn't really viable because it makes shadows, text boxes etc. jitter)

Config.Name: Dawn Of Mana id#12916
Config.Notes: D3D has some slowdown; Async in SPU can cause a hang if disabling the framelimiter; TC offset improves bloom alignment - can use HPO: Normal instead but this causes problems with shadows in some areas and texture alignment - TC offset fixes the issue without causing those problems

Config.Name: Dead To Rights id#2313
Config.Notes: FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Def Jam Fight For NY id#7205
Config.Notes: Minor issues with bloom, improved by HPO; MTVU can cause hangs

Config.Name: Devil Kings id#7210
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment; FXAA has about a 50% impact on maximum speed at 6x scaling; using no interlacing + progressive scan patch

Config.Name: Devil May Cry 3 Special Edition id#4930
Config.Notes: D3D performs worse than GL; there is slowdown in pause menu with 5x+ upscaling on GL (or at 4x with D3D); EE Round Mode fixes doors not able to be opened on Mission 18; HPO fixes bloom alignment; TC Offset fixes a line in FMVs

Config.Name: Devil May Cry id#15
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment; upper quarter of the screen has some weird blur/artifacting; slight amount of jitter in backgrounds from Bob tff; no interlacing patch doesn't work consistently - sometimes turns off when picking up some objects/going to the inventory screen - not using it

Config.Name: Dirge Of Cerberus Final Fantasy Vii id#839
Config.Notes: GL performs worse than D3D; HPO improves bloom alignment; has occasional slowdown; MTVU provides a very slight speed improvement (about 15%)

Config.Name: Disaster Report id#7214
Config.Notes: Skipdraw removes blur; cursor is missing in dialogue choices, but always starts at the top; relationship menu is blank - both issues can be resolved by temporarily switching to software mode via F9, or permanently setting the renderer to software; TC Offset fixes some upscaling lines

Config.Name: Disgaea 2 Cursed Memories id#7215
Config.Notes: Using 951555A0.pnach "cheat" to remove blur layer; some jitter in cutscenes from interlacing; Nearest texture filtering improves sprite quality; TC Offset fixes upscaling lines

Config.Name: Disgaea Hour Of Darkness id#7216
Config.Notes: Nearest texture filtering improves sprite quality; TC Offset fixes upscaling lines

Config.Name: Dot Hack Infection id#7218
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment

Config.Name: Dot Hack Mutation id#7219
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment

Config.Name: Dot Hack Outbreak id#7220
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment

Config.Name: Dot Hack Quarantine id#7221
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment

Config.Name: Downhill Domination id#21114
Config.Notes: Lens (sun) flares are visible through terrain in D3D (works in GL); MTVU causes graphical corruption

Config.Name: Dr. Muto id#7229
Config.Notes: Slowdown at 6x+ scaling; DSF fixes lines in shadows in D3D

Config.Name: Dragon Quest VIII Journey Of The Cursed King id#7226
Config.Notes: HPO (mostly) fixes black lines at the bottom and right of the screen, using Normal (Vertex) clears it out more but it also creates lines in certain textures, like water; can increase TC Offset X to completely remove the black lines but this creates lines elsewhere, like in menus; Round Sprite fixes lines in text (and Full improves the black lines too); DSF fixes ugly outline effect in GL (looks normal in D3D without it); lens flares are visible through walls in D3D (work correctly in GL); may need to use Software mode (F9) in Dark Realm to see Empyria's Shadow (unconfirmed)

Config.Name: Drakan The Ancients' Gates id#7227
Config.Notes: TC Offset improves upscaling lines; lens flares are visible through objects in D3D

Config.Name: Drakengard id#7228
Config.Notes: Bob tff causes small amout of jitter in cutscenes, but gameplay is sharper; Merge Sprite fixes lines in level completion screens; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Echo Night Beyond id#12412
Config.Notes: No longer has rendering issues in hardware, but has severe slowdown at times; widescreen hack causes graphical issues (black spiky polygons) and is disabled - widescreen mode can be enabled in-game, but will need to change screen size setting to 16:9 in PCSX2

Config.Name: Eoe Eve Of Extinction id#7245
Config.Notes: One vertical line in pause screen (minor)

Config.Name: Espgaluda id#30544
Config.Notes: Software renderer avoids graphics problems and upscaling is pointless since the game is entirely sprite-based; not using any texture filtering so image is sharper

Config.Name: Everblue 2 id#7246
Config.Notes: Has some slowdown at 6x scaling; using a patch to fix an issue where the edges of the screen aren't drawn when they should be, and unload earlier than they should, creating empty space where there shouldn't be - this is not the result of the widescreen patch as the issue persists even without it, tried all EE/IOP and VU options, no change - no issues with the patch; DSF is needed to fix lines in some textures - not needed in GL; D3D performs significantly better than GL (about 50% higher max speed)

Config.Name: EverGrace id#9656
Config.Notes: TC Offset improves some upscaling lines

Config.Name: Extermination id#12924
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes blur/depth of field alignment; Half Pixel Offset: Normal also fixes this but makes a thin lined box appear around the character until you refresh the screen (like by pressing F9 twice) - the TC Offset resolves the issue without creating the box; FMVs don't appear in HW renderers; FMVs look a bit worse because of FXAA but the rest of the game looks better; Software FMV hack isn't entirely stable in D3D (can cause hangs) so using GL; using no interlacing patch (big improvement because Bob deinterlacing causes some occasional jitter in depth of field effects)

Config.Name: Fantavision id#9687
Config.Notes: FXAA has an impact on performance; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Fatal Frame id#7250
Config.Notes: Align Sprite fixes vertical lines in some graphical effects; DSF fixes lines in photos; every once in a while the previously taken photo will flash on screen when first pulling out the camera; OPH Flag Hack hangs the game at the first FMV

Config.Name: Fatal Frame II Crimson Butterfly id#7251
Config.Notes: DSF fixes lines in certain frames; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Fatal Frame III The Tormented id#7252
Config.Notes: DSF fixes lines in certain frames; MTVU causes graphics corruption (blank textures)

Config.Name: Final Fantasy X id#20
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines in text/UI, mostly resolved by Round Sprite and TC Offset; lines appear in character's faces at TC Offset Y: 200+; skipdraw removes buggy depth of field

Config.Name: Final Fantasy XII id#87
Config.Notes: TC offset is to minimize garbage around FMVs

Config.Name: Fireblade id#7260
Config.Notes: MTVU negatively impacts performance; has some occasional slowdown

Config.Name: Flipnic Ultimate Pinball id#7263
Config.Notes: Disabled vsync to help reduce latency; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Forbidden Siren 2 id#17692
Config.Notes: FXAA is diabled because of software FMVs; Merge Sprite fixes vertical lines; Software FMV hack isn't entirely stable in D3D (can cause hangs) so using GL; FXAA does have an impact on performance

Config.Name: Forever Kingdom id#12780
Config.Notes: Missing some graphical elements with HW renderer

Config.Name: Forgotten Realms Demon Stone id#7265
Config.Notes: Some effects (fire/smoke) flicker in HW render; some occasional slowdown

Config.Name: Frequency id#7266
Config.Notes: Turning off vsync makes timing easier

Config.Name: Front Mission 4 id#7268
Config.Notes: Shadows are messed up with hardware rendering

Config.Name: Galerians Ash id#13855
Config.Notes: Has missing graphics and screen flashes colors in HW rendering

Config.Name: Gauntlet Dark Legacy id#7274
Config.Notes: D3D has some slowdown; some upscaling lines in text, improved by TC Offset

Config.Name: Ghosthunter id#7278
Config.Notes: Game has some occasional slowdown during certain effects at 4x+ (like when the first ghost appears and takes Jones); the audio has some very slight "pops" on occasion which aren't from slowdown, I tried alternate sync modes, alternate interpolation modes, and alternate output modules - none of them seemed to completely remedy the problem; Async mode is to help deal with some occasional slight blips in speed in heavy scenes

Config.Name: Glass Rose id#30686
Config.Notes: Select 60hz mode; character model is invisible in hardware rendering

Config.Name: Global Defence Force id#15133
Config.Notes: Skipdraw disables horizontal lines around objects; game has slowdown internally, even when emulation is running at 100% speed; bloom alignment issues on some levels; worse performance with GL; 8-bit textures improve performance; TC Offset improves some upscaling lines and bloom alignment

Config.Name: God Hand id#25
Config.Notes: Some occasional z-fighting; merge sprite fixes bluriness; wild arms offset fixes artifacts in cutscenes; slowdown at 5x+ upscaling; using no interlacing patch - doesn't jitter without it, but it cleans up the backbuffer a lot and makes it look sharper and brighter

Config.Name: God Of War id#26
Config.Notes: Fairly system-heavy game; large framebuffer on negatively impacts performance; occasional very brief dips below 60 fps which are pretty negligible with Async mode, set to 3x scaling if it's an issue or performance in general is poor; some missing graphical effects with D3D (fog)

Config.Name: Gradius V id#9604
Config.Notes: FXAA does have an impact on performance, but still runs at 250%+ with it on

Config.Name: Grand Theft Auto III id#4165
Config.Notes: Some occasional flickering (z-fighting) on distant textures (minor)

Config.Name: Grand Theft Auto Vice City id#4166
Config.Notes: Game is a bit blurry, but it's from the in-game effect "Trails" which can be disabled in the in-game display options - that alters the appearance quite a bit though

Config.Name: Grandia III id#12761
Config.Notes: Some occasional bloom alignment issues; "safe features" creates some small lines on character faces in D3D (not present in GL); title screen doesn't look quite right because of widescreen hack; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Gregory Horror Show id#29918
Config.Notes: Has audio skipping/repeating issues; FXAA has an impact on performance; some upscaling lines in text, not remedied by round sprite and TC offset just makes them worse; the no interlacing patch for this game causes FMVs to jitter whereas they don't with Bob tff deinterlacing and the difference during gameplay is negligible - not using it

Config.Name: Gun id#8377
Config.Notes: MTVU causes the game to hang; GL has weird color banding issues if Blending Accuracy is above None (doesn't happen in D3D); TC Offset fixes bloom alignment; D3D needs DSF to prevent lines in shadows, but this causes weird image flashing (like it does in Radiata Stories) - DSF isn't needed in GL; has some occasional slowdown at 4x+

Config.Name: Gungrave Overdose id#10245
Config.Notes: Round sprite + TC Offset fixes most upscaling lines in text and fixes garbage in FMVs from hardware rendering; text in text boxes extend beyond the box (from widescreen hack); some slowdown at 6x+ upscaling; disabling large framebuffer significantly improves performance

Config.Name: Hard Hitter Tennis id#13972
Config.Notes: Some occasional slowdown at 6x scaling

Config.Name: Haunting Ground id#9710
Config.Notes: Lighting / shadows don't work correctly in D3D; TC Offset fixes bloom alignment, can use HPO: Normal instead, but this creates lines in some textures and menus

Config.Name: Haven Call Of The King id#7294
Config.Notes: Blending accuracy has to be set to high for shadows to display properly; GL performs a little better than D3D in general, but GL has brief performance drop spikes not present in D3D; Align Sprite fixes some lines in shadows; TC Offset improves bloom/DOF alignment, although it does create two small lines in the menu (very minor)

Config.Name: Herdy Gerdy id#7972
Config.Notes: Widescreen hack cuts off some of the screen and impacts performance - disabled and running in 4:3; D3D has performance problems

Config.Name: Hunter The Reckoning Wayward id#17005
Config.Notes: Fog doesn't render correctly in D3D; FXAA has an impact on performance at 6x+

Config.Name: Ico id#2239
Config.Notes: Some minor visual bugs in some cutscenes; 4x scaling causes major slowdown in some cutscenes, still some occasional slowdown at 3x, but less; D3D has some additional visual bugs; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Jak II id#4867
Config.Notes: --fullboot required otherwise the game will start in Japanese; D3D has problems with shadows; MTVU and EE Cycle Rate improve performance; don't use EE Cycle Rate -2 (it drops/skips frames); occasionally a small amount of slowdown, more at 4x scaling; may need to switch to a D3D renderer in the weapons lab (unconfirmed)

Config.Name: Jaws Unleashed id#5363
Config.Notes: Some occasional slowdown at 6x+ scaling

Config.Name: Kinetica id#25238
Config.Notes: FXAA has an impact on performance at 6x+

Config.Name: Kingdom Hearts id#2559
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines in text/UI (minor)

Config.Name: King's Field The Ancient City id#12658
Config.Notes: Lines in sky and missing lava in hardware rendering; skipdraw 1 | 1 can be used to remove blur in hardware rendering

Config.Name: Kuon id#7331
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes bloom alignment; FXAA has an impact on performance at 6x+

Config.Name: Kya Dark Lineage id#7332
Config.Notes: Preload Frame Data fixes sun from displaying garbage textures; sun glare is visible through objects - not a huge deal; this can be fixed in one of two ways - either by enabling Auto Flush - which completely fixes it with no other visual side effects, however this has a massive impact on performance, so much so that it's not being used (but if your hardware can handle it without slowdown, use it, and the game should be basically perfect), alternately you can set skipdraw to 1 | 5 but this removes shadows, some fog, and lens flares (and causes some other occasional issues like white shadows when near some objects); HPO fixes line in distance; no issues in software; FMV is interlaced; FMVs flicker in hardware rendering so the Software FMV hack is used, can also be resolved by enabling large framebuffer but this negatively impacts performance; Async in SPU can cause a crash if the framelimiter is disabled; some occasional slowdown

Config.Name: Legaia 2 Duel Saga id#7334
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom alignment; Round Sprite fixes upscaling lines in text; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Legend Of Kay id#7336
Config.Notes: superVU VU1 setting fixes trees (which are just displayed as triangles with microVU); some texture flickering (z-fighting); some object disappear at certain angles (ropes, distant objects), even in software mode; some lines in text (minor), improved by Round Sprite: Full

Config.Name: Magna Carta Tears Of Blood id#7350
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines - mostly removed by TC Offset; moments where the screen is supposed to freeze and then blur (like after Calintz wakes up in the beginning) don't blur correctly, and freeze the image in focus with a black background, tried all video hacks (and GL) to no avail; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Manhunt id#4815
Config.Notes: Auto Flush + HPO fixes light through walls, but Auto flush has a pretty significant impact on performance at times (can drop to about 80%~ speed on occasion at 4x), so using 3x scaling (still looks good when combined with FXAA); EE cycle rate fixes hang when entering crane

Config.Name: Maximo Ghosts To Glory id#7358
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Maximo Vs. Army Of Zin id#8773
Config.Notes: DSF fixes puppet lines in shadows with D3D; fog doesn't render correctly in D3D; HPO fixes white outlines around trees; FXAA does have an impact on performance at higher scaling; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Metal Arms Glitch In The System id#7366
Config.Notes: mVU causes visual bugs (polygon freakouts); MTVU provides significant performance boost

Config.Name: Metal Gear Solid 2 Substance id#7367
Config.Notes: GL performs better than D3D; Async breaks

Config.Name: Metal Gear Solid 3 Subsistence id#6378
Config.Notes: Some occasional slowdown in cutscenes; performance is slightly worse with D3D; HPO fixes bloom alignment; EE cycle rate improves performance

Config.Name: Michigan Report From Hell id#14594
Config.Notes: Select 60hz mode; benefits greatly from MTVU

Config.Name: Midnight Club 3 Dub Edition Remix id#24524
Config.Notes: Half-screen Fix fixes headlight ghosting

Config.Name: Monster Hunter id#13102
Config.Notes: Round Sprite fixes some upscaling lines; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Monster Lab id#123358
Config.Notes: Unplayable in hardware mode (frozen graphics), OPH Flag Hack doesn't fix it

Config.Name: Mortal Kombat Armageddon id#4223
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes upscaling lines in text

Config.Name: Mortal Kombat Deception id#4817
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes upscaling lines in text

Config.Name: Mortal Kombat Shaolin Monks id#5388
Config.Notes: Some jitter on a few screens (minor) and some upscaling lines on title screen, mitigated a bit by the TC Offset (minor); GL performs worse than D3D; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: MotoGP 08 id#125703
Config.Notes: Some lines in text/menus (minor), improved by TC Offset

Config.Name: Need For Speed Underground id#5396
Config.Notes: Has some slowdown above 4x

Config.Name: Neo Contra id#7427
Config.Notes: Some occasional graphical corruption - water on level 1, glass in intro of level 2

Config.Name: Nightshade id#7442
Config.Notes: Some occasional slowdown, especially at 4x+; GL performs worse than D3D; TC Offset improves some upscaling lines in UI; Aggressive CRC improves performance; sound effects can break if you disable the framelimiter due to Async, but Async is recommended due to occasional blips in performance; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Obscure id#9070
Config.Notes: Significant texture flickering (z-fighting) with hardware rendering

Config.Name: Obscure II The Aftermath id#9069
Config.Notes: Significant texture flickering (z-fighting) with hardware rendering

Config.Name: Odin Sphere id#9326
Config.Notes: Round sprite fixes upscaling lines

Config.Name: Okage Shadow King id#12903
Config.Notes: Game has slowdown at times (like in Tenel) due to blending accuracy - significant speed increase by setting it to none but then you get messed up shadows (which you seemingly can't disable via skipdraw); slowdown is worse/more frequent at higher scaling, but seems to be basically the same from 2-4x; shadows don't work correctly in D3D; skipdraw removes buggy depth of field; polygons sometimes appear somewhat buggy (flickering) - this is true even in software mode; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Okami id#51
Config.Notes: Game is blurry due to post processing but this is accurate/part of the game - switch to software with F9 for comparison; post processing can be eliminated by setting CRC level to Aggressive - this eliminates certain graphical elements however and changes the art style significantly; HPO fixes bloom alignment

Config.Name: Oni id#9765
Config.Notes: Extreme slowdown on title screen and level title screens, but normal during gameplay

Config.Name: Onimusha 2 Samurai's Destiny id#9766
Config.Notes: Round Sprite + TC Offset fix the majority of upscaling lines; using no interlacing patch, can sometimes have a bit of jitter when loading a cutscene

Config.Name: Onimusha 3 Demon Siege id#9767
Config.Notes: HPO fixes bloom/blur alignment; Round Sprite fixes gaps between sprites in menus (this causes jitter if using Bob tff but works fine with the no interlacing patch); using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Onimusha Warlords id#8780
Config.Notes: Game is interlaced - Bob tff is sharper but this makes all backgrounds have intermittent jitter; FXAA doesn't have an impact on performance but has little to no discernable impact on visual fidelity because of Blend deinterlacing; TC offset fixes upscaling lines in text (can alternatively use Round Sprite, but it doesn't do quite as good/clean of a job)

Config.Name: Orphen Scion of Sorcery id#18999
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Outrun 2006 Coast 2 Coast id#4809
Config.Notes: Car selection screen (after choosing course) doesn't display properly in hardware rendering - press f9 to select car and then f9 again once complete; the game has intermittent slowdown, improved by cycle rate and MTVU; bloom is slightly misaligned, can be removed with skipdraw 1 | 2 although this makes the sun act somewhat strangely (flicker) so if you do that I'd recommend changing it to 1 | 4 instead (which completely disables the sun); radius line visible in some areas like tunnels, which can be removed with skipdraw (any) or with HPO: Special (but that messes up bloom alignment more); thick fog isn't as transparent as it should be; car shadows aren't quite right (swap to software rendering for comparison); TC Offset improves bloom alignment and water textures, but does create a few lines in the text/UI - can use Round Sprite: Full for perfect text but worse bloom/water and you can't have it both ways, because using TC Offset + Round Sprite really messes up textures in the UI, the current settings are preferable in my opinion; alternate settings to the current ones would likely be Round Sprite: Full + HPO: Special with no TC Offset (worse bloom, worse water texture, no lines in text/UI, no radius line)

Config.Name: Phantasy Star Generation 1 id#33571
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Phantasy Star Generation 2 id#94108
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Phantasy Star Universe id#9354
Config.Notes: Widescreen patch causes visual bugs (sporadic erroneous textures fill parts of the screen) - disabled in config; FXAA does have an impact on performance but still runs at 250%+ at 5x

Config.Name: Project Eden id#12827
Config.Notes: HPO fixes screen blur

Config.Name: Psi-Ops The Mindgate Conspiracy id#9778
Config.Notes: Skipdraw removes weird green layer; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: R-Type Final id#5390
Config.Notes: FXAA has an impact on performance, but still runs at 200%+ at 5x

Config.Name: Radiata Stories id#13303
Config.Notes: Frame Buffer Conversion fixes issues with ugly depth of field effect; HPO fixes bloom alignment; Allow 8-bit textures improves performance; CRC level of full improves performance over partial; "Disable Safe features" is needed to remove lines in some transitions (like the one before the title screen) in D3D, but doesn't play nicely with HPO (causes strange image flashing randomly), so using GL without that hack instead (which doesn't have the lines)

Config.Name: Rampage Total Destruction id#4797
Config.Notes: FXAA has an impact on performance, for very little benefit

Config.Name: Reel Fishing III id#149592
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines in UI/text, improved by TC Offset, adding in a TC Offset of X: 300 fixes more of them, but this creates a line in terrain; HPO fixes bloom alignment on distant terrain; MTVU negatively affects performance

Config.Name: Ratchet And Clank id#7797
Config.Notes: Missing background in pause and shop menus; a few very minor upscaling lines in text, improved slightly by TC Offset; game is a little blurry, this is actually internal / baked into the game, as there's a slight blur filter that can be disabled via skipdraw = 1 | 1 but this also disables shadows so that isn't used

Config.Name: Resident Evil Outbreak File #2 id#3947
Config.Notes: Blending accuracy above none causes a lot of slowdown in both GL and D3D - in the menus in D3D and in game in GL; Async breaks the audio; TC offset fixes lines in text

Config.Name: Resident Evil Outbreak id#3946
Config.Notes: Blending accuracy above none causes a lot of slowdown in both GL and D3D - in the menus in D3D and in game in GL; Async breaks the audio

Config.Name: Ring Of Red id#16726
Config.Notes: Lines in briefing segment backgrounds; software mode (F9) can be used if it's too much of an annoyance; they're present in FMVs too in hardware rendering so Software FMVs is enabled

Config.Name: Rise Of The Kasai id#9784
Config.Notes: Some blurring on menu selection screen from interlacing which can be corrected by using Bob bff but this causes pretty much everything else, including gameplay, to jitter

Config.Name: Robot Alchemic Drive id#9787
Config.Notes: Game has weird blur filter that causes horizontal lines - this effect is disabled with skipdraw; benefits greatly from MTVU

Config.Name: Rogue Galaxy id#9350
Config.Notes: Some postprocessing effects aren't quite right (like blur with fast movement); HPO fixes some bloom alignment issues; merge sprite fixes bloom on Juraika; Blending accuracy needs to be set to full otherwise text is gray instead of white; some upscaling lines in UI (minor)

Config.Name: Rule Of Rose id#12684
Config.Notes: Has some texture flicking (z-fighting) in outdoor areas - not present in software rendering

Config.Name: Rumble Roses id#9793
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Rune Viking Warlord id#20785
Config.Notes: Certain graphical effects don't display properly without GL and blending accuracy set to Full+ (like parts of the sky lighting); loading screens sometimes don't display the image properly; FXAA has a slight impact on performance

Config.Name: Rygar The Legendary Adventure id#5417
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: S.L.A.I. Steel Lancer Arena International id#11183
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes some upscaling lines

Config.Name: Samurai Western id#9802
Config.Notes: Needs Large Framebuffer to prevent some visual bugs (horizontal line through the screen at the beginning of the first level); occasional slowdown above 4x (like when destroying parts of buildings), blending accuracy above none can cause some slowdown; HPO fixes blurriness

Config.Name: Shadow Hearts Covenant id#12758
Config.Notes: Judgement ring sometimes doesn't display correctly (to be more accurate, everything around the judgement ring) with hardware rendering

Config.Name: Shadow Hearts id#12753
Config.Notes: EE/IOP clamping mode and 8-bit textures improves performance; interlacing causes flickering in battle completion screen and white transitions; FXAA has about a 10% impact on speed, disable if needed (PgUp); using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Shadow Of Destiny id#12245
Config.Notes: Some occasional z-fighting (not fixed by nearest texture filtering); shadows don't display in D3D; significant performance increase from MTVU

Config.Name: Shadow of Rome id#17004
Config.Notes: Slowdown at 5x+ upscaling; shadows and some other graphical effects don't work in hardware rendering - these are disabled with CRC level of partial or higher; half pixel offset fixes bloom; no longer requires PCSX2 1.2.1 for proper FMV audio as of dev 3278!; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Shadow Of The Colossus id#2240
Config.Notes: OPH Flag Hack provides a massive performance boost; mostly runs at full speed at 4x, but does have some occasional slowdown in colossus fights so using 3x which has none (or only very rarely); HPO fixes bloom alignment; blending accuracy has to be set to medium or higher for bloom to display properly; CRC level can be set to Aggressive to disable bloom; Vsync disabled helps improve performance; some texture flickering (z-fighting) issues on distant terrain; saw a report on the PCSX2 forums that MTVU decreases performance, but that isn't my experience at all - it was providing about a 25% speed increase in my testing

Config.Name: Shadow Tower Abyss id#12661
Config.Notes: Lighting flickers if Blending Accuracy is above None on both GL and D3D; GL has issue with sudden (erroneous) changes to lighting (suddenly goes from brighter to darker and vice versa), D3D doesn't have this issue but it's also way too dark by default - using shade boost with brightness at 85%; alternately set it to about 65% and change the in-game brightness up to max (preferable); both FXAA and each scaling step have a pretty significant impact on performance - about 50-80% for FXAA and about 100% per scaling step, opted for 4x + FXAA which results in about 350% but adjust as needed/wanted

Config.Name: Shin Megami Tensei Devil Summoner Raidou Kuzunoha Vs. The Soulless Army id#13111
Config.Notes: A few upscaling lines; tried the no interlacing patch and the game is clearly skipping frames when it's in use - it's very obvious when swapping between it and normal + Bob tff deinterlacing, Bob tff doesn't cause jitter in the game anyway, so better off with it

Config.Name: Shin Megami Tensei Digital Devil Saga 2 id#12547
Config.Notes: DSF fixes lines in shadows in D3D; occasional slowdown above 4x scaling; a couple lines in some UI elements (very minor); saw a report on the PCSX2 forums that MTVU negatively impacts performance but this wasn't my experience - it provided about 20% speed increase outside of combat and about 50% speed increase in combat in my testing; Async in SPU can break music if framelimiter is disabled; using progressive scan patch

Config.Name: Shin Megami Tensei Digital Devil Saga id#9329
Config.Notes: Using a customized version of the widescreen patch that doesn't remove shadows and enables progressive scan, because they work now; DSF fixes lines in shadows in D3D; a couple lines in some UI elements (very minor); saw a report on the PCSX2 forums that MTVU negatively impacts performance but this wasn't my experience - it provided about 20% speed increase outside of combat and about 50% speed increase in combat in my testing

Config.Name: Shin Megami Tensei Nocturne id#12344
Config.Notes: Some graphical effects aren't replicated in D3D, like the smoke around the woman in the intro (where you enter your name); D3D also needs "Disable Safe Features" to remove bugs with shadows; some objects have an ugly DoF effect around them which can be disabled by enabling Disable Depth Emulation but this causes overlapping shadows; Async can cause audio to stop working if framelimiter is disabled; FXAA has an impact on performance; using progressive scan patch

Config.Name: Shin Megami Tensei Persona 3 Fes id#9327
Config.Notes: DSF fixes shadows in D3D; FMVs are interlaced internally; FXAA does have an impact on performance, but still runs at 250%+, disable (PgUp) if needed

Config.Name: Shin Megami Tensei Persona 4 id#9328
Config.Notes: DSF fixes shadows in D3D; FXAA does have an impact on performance, but still runs at 300%+, disable (PgUp) if needed)

Config.Name: Shining Tears id#9808
Config.Notes: A few lines in text (minor), mostly fixed with TC offset; game is sprite-based, so not using FXAA

Config.Name: Shinobi id#4775
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Silent Hill 2 id#4793
Config.Notes: D3D performs a bit worse than GL; 6x scaling causes some occasional slowdown; FXAA has an impact on performance, but still runs at 200%+

Config.Name: Silent Hill 3 id#4794
Config.Notes: D3D is missing grain and shadows aren't right; FMVs don't display correctly/at all in hardware

Config.Name: Silent Hill 4 The Room id#5387
Config.Notes: D3D requires "Disable Safe Features" for shadows to display correctly, and performs worse than GL (some slowdown even at 4x scaling)

Config.Name: Silpheed The Lost Planet id#31894
Config.Notes: MTVU causes visual bugs in backgrounds; FXAA has about a 30% impact on speed

Config.Name: Siren id#9336
Config.Notes: Later levels have "wall of fog" in hardware

Config.Name: Skygunner id#9812
Config.Notes: Has slowdown above 4x on some levels (like start of second level); MTVU provides a small performance increase (about 15%); using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Sled Storm id#28351
Config.Notes: Lens flares are visible through objects in D3D

Config.Name: Sly Cooper And The Thievius Raccoonus id#9815
Soul Calibur III id#4788
Config.Notes: Occasional slowdown on some stages; graphical corruption on Will O The Wisp

Config.Name: Soul Reaver 2 id#4787
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Sphinx And The Cursed Mummy id#13365
Config.Notes: Some dots in text, can be adjusted with TC Offset X, but doing so eliminates some dots only to create others; FXAA has about a 25% impact on maximum speed

Config.Name: Spartan Total Warrior id#20786
Config.Notes: Aggressive CRC fixes brightness; EE timing fixes textures; texture flicker (z-fighting) on distant objects; FXAA has an impact on performance at higher scaling

Config.Name: Spyro Enter The Dragonfly id#9823
Config.Notes: MTVU causes graphical corruption

Config.Name: SSX 3 id#3760
Config.Notes: Increasing scaling above 4x starts to cause slowdown; small line visible in certain areas ahead of player, reduced by half pixel offset setting

Config.Name: SSX Tricky id#8378
Config.Notes: Character can become invisible/disconnected from camera without EE/IOP Round Mode setting

Config.Name: Star Ocean Till The End Of Time id#7973
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes vertical lines in transitions; DSF (plus TC Offset) is needed for D3D to prevent vertical lines in transitions, but this causes weird, random screen flashing (same as Radiata Stories), it's not needed in GL; there are a few lines in some UI elements from TC offset (minor)

Config.Name: Star Wars Bounty Hunter id#4782
Config.Notes: Some upscaling lines in UI (minor)

Config.Name: Star Wars Racer Revenge id#24555
Config.Notes: Grand Reefs and Citadel levels must be played in software mode (press F9) - major visual glitches from water effects; some screen flashing on some levels

Config.Name: State Of Emergency id#9036
Config.Notes: Alpha Stencil fixes shadow ghosting

Config.Name: Steambot Chronicles id#10708
Config.Notes: Hardware renderers are missing effects (fog, lighting, etc.); some occasional slowdown

Config.Name: Stella Deus The Gate Of Eternity id#12808
Config.Notes: Primarily sprite-based, so not using FXAA

Config.Name: Street Fighter Ex3 id#17304
Config.Notes: MTVU causes graphical corruption; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Stretch Panic id#25128
Config.Notes: Skipdraw disables blur layer; allow 8-bit helps with performance

Config.Name: Suikoden III id#12388
Config.Notes: Some dots in dialogue boxes (minor)

Config.Name: Suikoden V id#12394
Config.Notes: Some lines in dialogue boxes and menus (minor); TC offset mostly removes it; can be removed completely by setting texture filtering to nearest, but then some transparent effects like clouds don't display correctly

Config.Name: Summoner 2 id#13117
Config.Notes: A few lines around text/sprites (minor); FXAA does have an impact on performance, but still runs at 250%+

Config.Name: Summoner id#12490
Config.Notes: Dark rectangle in upper left corner of screen with hardware rendering

Config.Name: Tales Of Legendia id#12453
Config.Notes: Merge sprite fixes screen blur; Some shadows don't display correctly (puppet lines) in D3D without DSF, but this hides dialogue boxes, no issue in GL; TC Offset fixes upscaling lines in UI; saw a report that MTVU decreases performance - in my testing it didn't decrease it, but it didn't improve it either, so it's disabled; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Tales Of The Abyss id#13119
Config.Notes: HPO fixes screen blur; sunlight bloom occasionally doesn't look quite right (makes some kindof chunky yellow areas) and it isn't fixed with Frame Buffer Conversion or alternate HPO setting; in a few areas the left and right screen don't render quite right from widescreen hack

Config.Name: Tekken 5 id#3753
Config.Notes: In Options -> Display Settings set scan mode to "sharp", video mode to "normal", and aspect ratio to 16:9 - do not use "progressive" video mode; Align Sprite fixes vertical lines; MTVU provides a significant performance boost

Config.Name: Tekken Tag Tournament id#3770
Config.Notes: Align Sprite fixes vertical lines; using no interlacing patch - includes versions for both v1.00 and v2.00 discs; FMVs jitter with the no interlacing patch and don't with Bob tff, but the rest of the game looks sharper with the patch than Bob tff does

Config.Name: Tenchu Wrath Of Heaven id#13122
Config.Notes: TC Offset fixes some upscaling lines; cutscenes jitter from interlacing; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: The Bouncer id#5914
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: The Getaway id#7449
Config.Notes: Has occasional slowdown in some cutscenes; this can be reduced by increasing VU cycle stealing (starting at 1 is recommended) but this causes frame pacing issues/jitteriness which is especially noticeable in play, it's a tradeoff; missing shadows in hardware renderers; Allow 8-bit textures, MTVU, and EE Cycle rate all improve performance

Config.Name: The King Of Fighters 2006 id#7453
Config.Notes: Some lines in text (minor)

Config.Name: The Lord Of The Rings The Fellowship Of The Ring id#7454
Config.Notes: Graphical issue on opening memory card screen

Config.Name: The Lord Of The Rings The Return Of The King id#7455
Config.Notes: Some text in menus will be missing unless you switch to Software mode (F9); in-game is fine in hardware rendering - press F9 after you complete a level and again when starting the next level; can have some occasional slowdown

Config.Name: The Lord Of The Rings The Third Age id#7456
Config.Notes: Occasionally some black vertical semi-transparent bars will appear, press F9 to switch to software, then F9 to switch back to remove them - it's fairly rare with the settings used; occasionally there are some very slight lingering ghost lines (minor, but fairly frequent); occasionally a small black semi-transparent box will appear in the upper left part of the screen (minor)

Config.Name: The Lord Of The Rings The Two Towers id#7457
Config.Notes: Half Pixel Offset fixes line beyond fog (Moria etc.); D3D has some slowdown

Config.Name: The Mark Of Kri id#7458
Config.Notes: Bob tff causes small amount of jitter in cutscenes, but gameplay is sharper

Config.Name: The Nightmare Of Druaga Fushigino Dungeon id#7459
Config.Notes: DSF fixes lines in pause menu

Config.Name: The Red Star id#9956
Config.Notes: Game has radius line that can be mostly mitigated with Half Pixel Offset: Special (Texture - Aggressive) but Skipdraw = 1 | 1 completely eliminates it - it does remove some other minor elements in the process, switch to HPO if it bothers you; some elements don't render correctly (like on the first boss) without Accurate Date=Full; FXAA has an impact on performance, but provides a pretty substantial visual benefit at 4x, disable (PgUp) if needed

Config.Name: The Thing id#5397
Config.Notes: FMVs flicker in hardware rendering

Config.Name: The X-Files Resist Or Serve id#4766
Config.Notes: Set the aspect ratio to widescreen in options > video > aspect ratio; DSF fixes issues with shadows in D3D

Config.Name: Trapt id#12901
Config.Notes: Numerous graphical bugs in hardware rendering; none in software rendering

Config.Name: Tsugunai Atonement id#13943
Config.Notes: MTVU causes graphical corruption (blank textures)

Config.Name: Twisted Metal Black id#7922
Config.Notes: Jitter in cutscenes and menus from Bob deinterlacing, set to Auto if it bothers you; D3D performs slightly worse than GL

Config.Name: Twisted Metal Head-On - Extra Twisted Edition id#12336
Config.Notes: Cutscenes are off-center - this is not because of hardware rendering or the widescreen hack, it's like that even with them disabled and the video set to 4:3; MTVU causes graphical corruption with skybox

Config.Name: Unlimited Saga id#9835
Config.Notes: Widescreen hacks are disabled because combat areas are still 4:3, not 16:9 with them on, which looks quite weird; game is primarily sprite-based, so FXAA isn't used

Config.Name: Urban Chaos Riot Response id#9838
Config.Notes: Has some occasional slowdown, more or less depending on the level, if it's too bad, reduce scaling to 3x; FXAA doesn't appear to affect speed one way or the other; greatly benefits from MTVU; TC offset fixes some of the effects alignment (can use HPO: Special Texture alternatively, but the alignment is off with this option if using 3x scaling); bloom alignment on light sources is off, can be corrected by enabling Auto Flush but this has a massive impact on performance so it isn't used

Config.Name: Urban Reign id#9836
Config.Notes: Game is interlaced - Bob deinterlacing modes makes gameplay clearer but all menus jitter; Align Sprite fixes vertical lines; a weird garbage texture is momentarily flashed on the screen when winning/losing a match

Config.Name: V-Rally 3 id#122314
Config.Notes: Hardware modes have major graphical problems; software regularly runs at 85-90% speed; might want to consider using the PAL version since 90% NTSC is over 100% PAL - it's about 54 FPS

Config.Name: Valkyrie Profile 2 Silmeria id#9330
Config.Notes: Widescreen needs to be enabled in-game (prompts as soon as you start the game) and not via hack (which has bugs); some bloom misalignment in some areas (software rendering fixes it); HPO helps with bloom alignment; Round Sprite: Half fixes lines in transitions (using Full creates semi-transparent "seams" in FMVs); some areas (like the forest) have a grid that can be removed by switching to software mode (F9); Frame Buffer Conversion and Merge Sprite fix ugly depth of field; some occasional slowdown

Config.Name: Vexx id#9839
Config.Notes: Image freezes on last frame when entering water or using tutorial orbs with hardware rendering, not present in software

Config.Name: Viewtiful Joe id#2775
Config.Notes: Some rendering errors in the intro (when the robot is knocked through the screen) even in software mode; shadows sometimes aren't positioned correctly (in the middle of characters) even in software mode; some areas are a little bit blurry, not improved by deinterlacing or HPO

Config.Name: War Of The Monsters id#11520
Config.Notes: Some interlacing jitter in cutscenes / loading; MTVU causes graphical corruption

Config.Name: Way Of The Samurai 2 id#12468
Config.Notes: A few lines from upscaling; mitigated somewhat by round sprite

Config.Name: Way Of The Samurai id#12467
Config.Notes: Round sprite fixes upscaling lines in text/UI; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Whiplash id#10022
Config.Notes: Using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Wild Arms 3 id#12908
Config.Notes: Character lighting isn't quite right in D3D (too bright); WAO corrects lines in text; FXAA does have an impact on performance, but still runs at 200%+; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Wild Arms 4 id#5425
Config.Notes: WAO corrects lines in text; Round Sprite: Full removes upscaling lines, but creates semi-transparent "seams" in the image - Merge Sprite fixes this, can use TC Offset X: 300 as an alternative to Round Sprite + Merge Sprite but it creates lines elsewhere

Config.Name: Wild Arms 5 id#12774
Config.Notes: Merge sprite removes some semi-transparent "seams" in textures; frame buffer conversion fixes sepia-tone flashback sequences; DSF fixes some horizontal lines in some transition effects; Round Sprite: Full fixes upscaling lines

Config.Name: Wild Arms Alter Code F id#12776
Config.Notes: Character lighting isn't quite right in D3D (too bright); WAO corrects lines in text; using no interlacing patch

Config.Name: Wipeout Fusion id#8363
Config.Notes: Fairly CPU-intensive game; EE cycle rate and SPU settings help provide better/more consistent performance; MTVU seems to have a slightly negative impact on performance

Config.Name: Wizardry Tale Of The Forsaken Land id#12246
Xenosaga Episode I Der Wille Zur Macht id#5426
Config.Notes: Some upscaling lines around some text/sprites in battle - can be mitigated somewhat with TC offset but doing so makes other lines appear elsewhere

Config.Name: XGIII Extreme G Racing id#9683
Config.Notes: Jitter in loading screens from interlacing

Config.Name: XGRA Extreme G Racing Association id#129397
Yakuza 2 id#3921
Config.Notes: Using CRC level of partial or higher sometimes reduces the resolution after a cutscene has ended - even without the Software FMV fix enabled - an example is the scene after the FMV with the fire at the beginning; depth of field/bloom/blur alignment is a little bit off, it's improved by TC offset but it's not perfect - X 200 / Y 200 is closer but as soon as the X offset is adjusted it creates a semi-transparent line in the middle of the screen (same with using HPO); Preload Frame Data fixes the majority of cases where there's weird light areas in the bottom/right side of the screen (though not 100%)

Config.Name: Yakuza id#8500
Config.Notes: Using CRC level of partial or higher causes some occasionally really bizarre bloom/blur/depth of field behavior - like in the area as you turn right to go down the street on the first mission as an example (there's a large Canyon cigarettes sign in the middle/top of the screen); depth of field/bloom/blur alignment is a little bit off, it's improved by TC offset but it's not perfect - X 200 / Y 200 is closer but as soon as the X offset is adjusted it creates a semi-transparent line in the middle of the screen (same with using HPO); Preload Frame Data might help with issues later, since it does in Yakuza 2, but I didn't encounter any instances of it so it's not enabled currently

Config.Name: Battle Engine Aquila id#12008
Config.Notes: VU Clamping mode fixes broken menus; HPO fixes bloom alignment

Config.Name: Cocoto Fishing Master id#129402
Config.Notes: HPO + Merge Sprite fix bloom alignment; FXAA has an impact on performance

Config.Name: Gallop Racer 2006 id#9699
Config.Notes: FXAA has about a 30% impact on maximum performance; skipdraw removes jittery depth of field; round sprite fixes some upscaling lines
